definition: Gang of Four: Jiang Qing 江青, Zhang Chunqiao 張春橋, Yao Wenyuan 姚文元, Wang Hongwen 王洪文, who served as scapegoats for the excesses of the cultural revolution
four/4
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
to help/to assist/to support/for sb (i.e. as a help)/hired (as worker)/side (of pail, boat etc)/outer layer/upper (of a shoe)/group/gang/clique/party/secret society

sentences.english: The question of exposing and criticizing the Gang of Four and consolidating the leading bodies.
sentences.chinese: 關於揭批“四人幫”和整頓領導班子的問題。

sentences.english: "The gang of four" was an ambitious political Clique.
sentences.chinese: “四人幫”是個野心勃勃的政治小集團。

sentences.english: The arrests of the Gang of Four symbolically ended the era of upheaval and self-imposed isolation.
sentences.chinese: 四人幫被逮捕象徵着動盪不安和自我封鎖時代的結束。

sentences.english: Capitalism is a term invented by Karl Marx.
sentences.chinese: “四人幫”創造了一個名詞叫“臭老九”。

sentences.english: Hua's role in the arrests is unclear.
sentences.chinese: 華國鋒在四人幫被捕中的作用至今不甚明瞭。

sentences.english: Of course, Lin Biao and the "Gang of four" is whether these.
sentences.chinese: 當然，林彪和“四人幫”是不管這些的。

sentences.english: Catching the " Gang of Four " at one stroke.
sentences.chinese: 一舉把“四人幫”捉拿歸案。

sentences.english: Hua and his moderate allies quickly arrested the Gang of Four.
sentences.chinese: 華國鋒及其溫和派人士迅速逮捕了四人幫。

sentences.english: The Gang of Four labelled intellectuals the "stinking Number Nine".
sentences.chinese: “四人幫”創造了一個名詞叫“臭老九”。

sentences.english: That word is a recent coinage.
sentences.chinese: “四人幫”創造了一個名詞叫“臭老九”。

sentences.english: Even today, much effort is still needed to eliminate the pernicious influence of these absurdities spread by the Gang.
sentences.chinese: “四人幫”這些謬論的流毒，現在仍然需要大力肅清。

definition: reactionaries
to drag sb before a public meeting to denounce, humiliate and physically abuse them (esp. during the Cultural Revolution)
fire of war everywhere (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
to execute by firing squad/same as 槍斃|枪毙
political movement
Red Guards (Cultural Revolution, 1966-1976)
Liu Shaoqi (1898-1969), Chinese communist leader, a martyr of the Cultural Revolution
South Korea
Hua Guofeng (1921-2008), leader of Chinese Communist Party after the Cultural Revolution
Manchukuo
executioner/headsman/slaughterer/fig. indiscriminate murderer
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
Korean War (1950-1953)
president (of a country)/same as 總統|总统
Zhang Guotao (1897-1979), Chinese communist leader in the 1920s and 1930s, defected to Guomindang in 1938
opportunism/pragmatism
